channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Rensselaer Professor Receives $3.7 Million Grant for Alzheimer’s Disease Research
item.description: Chunyu Wang, M.D., Ph.D., professor of biological sciences and chemistry and chemical biology at Rensselaer, has been awarded a five-year grant of more than $3.7 million by the National Institutes of Health’s National Institute on Aging to study Apolipoprotein E isoform interactions with heparan sulfate (HS) in Alzheimer’s disease.

item.title: An Important Message from the Administration Division Regarding Summer Temperatures
item.description: Due to the extreme summer heat, Physical Plant is asking the campus community to take as many additional measures as possible to conserve energy and reduce cooling and electrical demand through Friday, June 21.
item.author: Community

item.title: DotCIO to Host Retirement Party for Jeff Miner July 12
item.description: From 1:00 PM to 4:00 PM on Friday, July 12 in the Heffner Alumni House Great Hall, all members of the campus community are welcome to join DotCIO in extending their best wishes to Jeff Miner, who is retiring after his many years of dedicated service here at Rensselaer. Please be sure to RSVP by Wednesday, July 3.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Advocacy at Rensselaer” Pride Panel Event Scheduled for June 24
item.description: Date: Monday, June 24, 2024 5:30 PM - 6:30 PM - Come spend an evening with the RPI Society of Women Engineers (SWE) and members of the RPI LGBTQ+ campus community to learn about allyship, inclusion, and how you can advocate for yourself and others during Pride Month! This event is hybrid, so those who wish to attend in person can stop by the Shelnutt Gallery in the Rensselaer Union, or can choose to participate (anonymously) via Webex.
item.author: Community

item.title: ECSE Seminar to be Held June 24
item.description: Date: Monday, June 24, 2024 10:30 AM - 11:30 AM - Join ECSE for a seminar titled “Physiological Radar for Biomedical Monitoring and Smart Buildings” with Olga Borić –Lubecke and Victor Manuel Lubecke, of the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering at University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, Hawaii.
item.author: Community

item.title: Event to Feature Hiking at the Albany Pinebush Reserve
item.description: Date: Wednesday, June 26, 2024 9:00 AM - 12:30 PM - The Albany Pinebush Reserve is a very unique environment to experience, and a Conservation Director will join the walk to provide explanations of what the group will see. Participation is limited to 22 students; please contact Sarah Greene to sign up or if you have questions. Remember to bring a big bottle of water; restrooms will be available at the trailhead visitor center.
item.author: Students

item.title: Don’t Miss the Freihofer’s Saratoga Jazz Festival at SPAC!
item.description:
Date: Saturday, June 29, 2024 11:00 AM - 9:00 PM - Kick off summer with good times and great vibes at the 47th Annual Freihofer’s Saratoga Jazz Festival, featuring two days, two stages and 22 electrifying artists from jazz to funk, blues, indie and pop! Limited tickets and bus transportation passes for both days (June 29 and 30) are available at the Union Admin Office.
